text: Rodney Dangerfield (born Jacob Rodney Cohen, November 22, 1921 â€“ October 5, 2004) was an American comedian, movie, television, stage, radio, voice actor, writer, and singer. He was known for his catchphrase "I don't get no respect!" He was in the movies Easy Money, Caddyshack, and Back to School. He won a Grammy Award. Dangerfield was born on November 22, 1921 in Babylon, New York. He was married to Joyce Indig from 1949 until they divorced in 1961. They remarried in 1963 and divorced again in 1973. From 1993 until his death in 2004, he was married to Joan Child. He has two children with Indig. Dangerfield died on October 5, 2004 in Westwood, Los Angeles, California from complications from surgery, aged 82. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Article about Dangerfield from a Kew Gardens website * Audio interview with Fresh Air's Terry Gross from 7/6/04 * Episode capsule for Simpsons episode #4F05 "Burns, Baby Burns" * Category:1921 births Category:2004 deaths Category:Actors from New York (state) Category:American movie actors Category:American radio actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:American Jews Category:Writers from New York (state) Category:Singers from New York (state) Category:Deaths from surgical complications Category:American Grammy Award winners Category:American voice actors Category:Comedians from New York (state)
title: Rodney Dangerfield
